Comment.Language: The leaven (from the presanctified Myron) can be added either once or in three installments, in which case three liturgies are celebrated during the same week and the leaven of the Myron and the Hagelion are added at the conclusion of each. As for the readings of these liturgies, they are as follows:

After giving communion to the fathers the bishops and the priests and the deacons, His Holiness the Pope covers the divine sacrifice while the fathers the priests carry the Â Myron vessels to the altar of the offering. The fathers the bishops remove their stoles and the senior priest presents the leaven from the old presanctified Myron to His Holiness the Pope and his Holiness deposits the holy leaven saying:
His Holiness repeats this thrice and the people respond likewise, and this is repeated for each vessel.
His Holiness the Pope, followed by the fathers the bishops each one according to his rank, pray these verses and after each verse the chanters respond:

Text.Language: Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord of Hosts. Heaven and Earth are full of your holy glory.

Immanuel our God is now in our midst, in the glory of His Father, and the Holy Spirit. May He bless us all, purify our hearts, and heal the sicknesses of our souls and our bodies.

Comment.Language: After this the vessels of the Hagelion are brought and the holy leaven shall be deposited in them and His Holiness says â€œBlessed be the Lord Jesus Christâ€¦â€? once for each vessel, and the people shall respond â€œOne is the All-Holy Fatherâ€¦â€? And the previous verses shall be said. Then the vessels are returned to the synthronos. The synthronos is the place of the throne of the bishop or the Pope that used to be in the niche at the eastern part of the sanctuary (The bosom of the Father).
